page.title: 04Transport around Kilby
page.content: Although on the main Leicester to London railway there is no operational station in the block,the nearest being either Leicester or Market Harborough each some 10 miles distant. The block also contains part of the Grand Union Canal but the main form of transport remains the motor car. There are no services for motor transport in the block but they are available close by. The block contains part of the A50 trunk road (leicester to Northampton). The remainder are minor roads linking with the surrounding villages of Countesthorpe,Great Glen,Kibworth Beauchamp and Fleckney. Many of these are difficult to drive on owing to many sharpe bends and narrow lanes.Many of the roads in the block are heavily used as commuter routes especially the A50 which is considered a dangerous road.
